result.execSummary:
The defendant Stevie R Lemacher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $100.00 per month and each month thereafter.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine payments.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stevie R Lemacher

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:45 AM Defendant Stevie R Lemacher in court with attorney Abigail J. Broze.  Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a plea colloquy with the Defendant.
The Defendant pleads guilty to Count 3.
The Court finds the Defendant guilty of Count 3.
Counts 1 & 2 are dismissed and read into Count 3.

The State gives its sentencing recommendation.
The Defense gives its sentencing recommendation.
The Defendant presents a statement.

Court orders the following:
	
Costs/Fine:  $316.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Payment of Fine/Forfeiture/Costs/Surcharges:  Defendant to pay $100.00 per month commencing September 01, 2022 and each month thereafter until satisfied.  Civil judgment to be entered as penalty for non payment.

HOW TO PAY:
Payments can be made on-line with a MasterCard or electronic check at:  http://wcca.wicourts.gov  (Read the agreement, then click "I agree," then click "Pay fees on-line.")  OR you may contact the Waukesha County Clerk of Courts Business Center at 262-548-7497.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Pre-trial conference on July 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

03:15 PM Attorney Brandon Carlson for Abigail J. Broze in court.   Defendant Stevie R Lemacher did not appear.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests to file an authorization at this time.  
Court grants request.
Defense reqeusts adjournment.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on June 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

01:46 PM Defendant Stevie R Lemacher in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
10:22 AM Defendant Stevie R Lemacher not in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
